customer_name: TURK HAVA YOLLARI A O TURKISH AIRLINES
customer_addr:
350 FIFTH AVENUE, SUITE 7510
NEW YORK, NY 10118
site_name: TURK HAVA YOLLARI AO TURKISH AIRLINES - LAX - Los Angeles International Airport

citations.narrative:
On December 11, 2023, Turkish Airlines transported 1 Devon Rex hairless kitten, approximately 4 months old, to Los
Angeles airport (LAX) and was found deceased at time of arrival. According to documentation, AWB: 235-504-26051, the
flight began in Moscow (VKO) to Istanbul (IST) on flight TK420 with a final destination at LAX on flight TK179 on
December 12,2023. The flight time was approximately 19 to 20 hours, excluding wait times and loading and unloading of
the kitten.
Documents provided show 1 kitten was alive in VKO prior to boarding for LAX. Although the AWB states airplane cargo
temperatures range from 59 to 77 degrees Fahrenheit (F), the facility representative has stated the temperature, altitude,
flight time, and cabin temperature values can vary between the minimum and the maximum values, depending on the
amount and type of cargo. Therefore, short temperature deviations may occur during flight.
On December 11, 2023 the temperature In Moscow ranged between 16-19 degrees F, 85% Humidity (H), in Istanbul 45-
54 degrees F, daily average 87% H, and at LAX, ranged between 50-68 degrees F, 88% H on December 12, 2023.
According to the documentation provided by the Center of Disease Control Los Angeles Quarantine Station, the kitten
was deceased on arrival. The kitten’s transport crate was lined with a litter pad and additional padding. There were no
indications of added measures taken to protect the cat or reduce the effects from the potential rigors of travel including
temperature fluctuations during this transport.
The facility representative stated the airline has placed an embargo on transporting hairless cat breeds to LAX.
When climatic conditions present a threat to an animal's health or well-being, appropriate measures must be taken to
alleviate the impact of those conditions. An animal may never be subjected to any combination of temperature, humidity,
and time, that is detrimental to the animal's health or well-being, taking into consideration such factors as the animal's
age, species, breed, overall health status, and acclimation.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
TYLER FIELDS, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.131(e)  Critical Repeat
   
Handling of animals. 
On December 11, 2023, Turkish Airlines transported 1 Devon Rex hairless kitten, approximately 4 months old, to Los 
Angeles airport (LAX) and was found deceased at time of arrival. According to documentation, AWB: 235-504-26051, the 
flight began in Moscow (VKO) to Istanbul (IST) on flight TK420 with a final destination at LAX on flight TK179 on 
December 12,2023. The flight time was approximately 19 to 20 hours, excluding wait times and loading and unloading of 
the kitten.  
Documents provided show 1 kitten was alive in VKO prior to boarding for LAX. Although the AWB states airplane cargo 
temperatures range from 59 to 77 degrees Fahrenheit (F), the facility representative has stated the temperature, altitude, 
flight time, and cabin temperature values can vary between the minimum and the maximum values, depending on the 
amount and type of cargo. Therefore, short temperature deviations may occur during flight. 
On December 11, 2023 the temperature In Moscow ranged between 16-19 degrees F, 85% Humidity (H), in Istanbul 45-
54 degrees F, daily average 87% H, and at LAX, ranged between 50-68 degrees F, 88% H on December 12, 2023. 
According to the documentation provided by the Center of Disease Control Los Angeles Quarantine Station, the kitten 
was deceased on arrival. The kitten’s transport crate was lined with a litter pad and additional padding. There were no 
indications of added measures taken to protect the cat or reduce the effects from the potential rigors of travel including 
temperature fluctuations during this transport. 
The facility representative stated the airline has placed an embargo on transporting hairless cat breeds to LAX.  
 
When climatic conditions present a threat to an animal's health or well-being, appropriate measures must be taken to 
alleviate the impact of those conditions. An animal may never be subjected to any combination of temperature, humidity, 
and time, that is detrimental to the animal's health or well-being, taking into consideration such factors as the animal's 
age, species, breed, overall health status, and acclimation. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.

TYLER FIELDS, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
